snippet.textDisplay: @dertien vijfenvijftig Yup! Yoko Shimomura is, as far as I know, the only composer for Final Fantasy XV. If you listen to the Night Battle Theme, you can definitely hear her style, mostly Kingdom Hearts.
snippet.textOriginal: @dertien vijfenvijftig Yup! Yoko Shimomura is, as far as I know, the only composer for Final Fantasy XV. If you listen to the Night Battle Theme, you can definitely hear her style, mostly Kingdom Hearts.

snippet.textDisplay: @ccoplien It's not. It is from the composer of Super Mario Rpg (Snes), Live A Live (Snes), Legend of Mana (PS1), Bowser's Inside Story (DS).
snippet.textOriginal: @ccoplien It's not. It is from the composer of Super Mario Rpg (Snes), Live A Live (Snes), Legend of Mana (PS1), Bowser's Inside Story (DS).

snippet.textDisplay:
"What do you mean, you don't know?
"...You haven't realized it yet?
"The thing you've been fighting, this whole time...
"You should already know what it is, where it came from...
_"You_, of all people, have no right to feign ignorance any longer..."
Bit of original monologue I've had around for a couple months.
snippet.textOriginal:
"What do you mean, you don't know?
"...You haven't realized it yet?
"The thing you've been fighting, this whole time...
"You should already know what it is, where it came from...
_"You_, of all people, have no right to feign ignorance any longer..."
Bit of original monologue I've had around for a couple months.

snippet.textDisplay:
Parasite Eve 1 and 2 are really underrated.
But back then with other horror games like Resident Evil and Silent Hill the competition was much bigger than it is now.
kinda strange that the most popular and known horror games are from Japan.
snippet.textOriginal:
Parasite Eve 1 and 2 are really underrated.
But back then with other horror games like Resident Evil and Silent Hill the competition was much bigger than it is now.
kinda strange that the most popular and known horror games are from Japan.

snippet.textDisplay: Not sure how any of you can think parasite eve or resident evil were scary games. Silent Hill I do agree at least as far as the first 2 games. But the others....meh<_<. I think all you western weaboos give japanese horror more credit then it should be given.
snippet.textOriginal: Not sure how any of you can think parasite eve or resident evil were scary games. Silent Hill I do agree at least as far as the first 2 games. But the others....meh<_<. I think all you western weaboos give japanese horror more credit then it should be given.

snippet.textDisplay: Japanese horror games of ole were the first of its kind coming west. Western games back then were not trying to tap into that genre. Same with how the east wasn't even trying to make FPS games and now they are. So yeah not exactly surprised.
snippet.textOriginal: Japanese horror games of ole were the first of its kind coming west. Western games back then were not trying to tap into that genre. Same with how the east wasn't even trying to make FPS games and now they are. So yeah not exactly surprised.

snippet.textOriginal: Owari Dragon Parasite Eve 2 was geared more on the Resident Evil survival horror elements

snippet.textDisplay: Amnesia, but it's from Europe which follows the style of horror known as "gothic horror" so I can't count that as an American horror game. I guess it's probably one of the few powerful horror games outside of Japan.
snippet.textOriginal: Amnesia, but it's from Europe which follows the style of horror known as "gothic horror" so I can't count that as an American horror game. I guess it's probably one of the few powerful horror games outside of Japan.

snippet.textDisplay: @Owari Dragon I think Outlast represents the best you can get out of jumpscares and such. It's a great game, but it was already playing with a worn-out genre. Probably the most one can expect.
snippet.textOriginal: @Owari Dragon I think Outlast represents the best you can get out of jumpscares and such. It's a great game, but it was already playing with a worn-out genre. Probably the most one can expect.

snippet.textDisplay:
first fase: is this the final boss? a baby? hahaha, this should be  very easy
second fase: well, this is not what i expected, should be a little bit hard, and I don't have many health items left, so in 1 or 2 times I load game I should beat it
third fase: what? is it finally dead? no, it is in its mature form. ok, i'm fucked up  :)

snippet.textDisplay: if you are a fan of sci-fi but with tremendous and true-possible science background then ur gonna love the story. its just breathtaking. for the gameplay i'd say the battles are decent, i liked it. short enough to finish it in 10 hours. the only thing is that she moves around somewhat slow. and if you want to finish it 100% ur gonna have to invest twice the time to finish it once

snippet.textDisplay: Running away from U.B. (Ultimate Being) in the end scared me the first time I played this game. :P Classic Shimomura here when she goes for darker songs. It could fit right into a Kingdom Hearts soundtrack, especially the panning notes going from low to high at 2:38. I just noticed she uses that a lot in final bosses like in KH2, Mario&Luigi 3's final boss, Live a Live's final boss and maybe more.
snippet.textOriginal: Running away from U.B. (Ultimate Being) in the end scared me the first time I played this game. :P Classic Shimomura here when she goes for darker songs. It could fit right into a Kingdom Hearts soundtrack, especially the panning notes going from low to high at 2:38. I just noticed she uses that a lot in final bosses like in KH2, Mario&Luigi 3's final boss, Live a Live's final boss and maybe more.
